dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, Elon Musk. You know, the Tesla and SpaceX guy. Forbes pegs his fortune at, like, over $23 billion. Wild, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, Elon Musk. You know, the Tesla and SpaceX guy. Forbes pegs his fortune at, like, over twenty three billion dollars. Wild, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO confirmed he has roughly a $20 billion fortune (Forbes pegs it at $23.6 billion), but added that his liquid assets are relatively low.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally wild! But what’s even wilder, Host A, is he just confirmed that despite all that, he's actually, uh, really cash poor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally wild! But what's even wilder, Host A, is he just confirmed that despite all that, he's actually, uh, really cash poor.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO confirmed he has roughly a $20 billion fortune (Forbes pegs it at $23.6 billion), but added that his liquid assets are relatively low. Some people think I have a lot of cash, he said. I actually dont.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he said, "Some people think I have a lot of cash... I actually don't." Which, um, is pretty surprising for someone with that kind of net worth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he said, Some people think I have a lot of cash... I actually don't. Which, um, is pretty surprising for someone with that kind of net worth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some people think I have a lot of cash, he said. I actually dont.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: It is! But when you dig into it, it makes sense. Like, 99% of his wealth is tied up in shares of Tesla and SpaceX. So, not a lot of liquid assets floating around.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It is! But when you dig into it, it makes sense. Like, ninety nine percent of his wealth is tied up in shares of Tesla and SpaceX. So, not a lot of liquid assets floating around.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As much as 99% of Musks wealth is held in shares of those two companies, Forbes estimates, which helps explain his lack of liquidity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: And this is all coming out, you know, with this big trial he's got going on. The stakes are getting pretty high.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is all coming out, you know, with this big trial he's got going on. The stakes are getting pretty high.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The revelation adds to the stakes of the trial.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Because if the jury slaps him with a big judgment, he might actually have to sell off parts of Tesla or SpaceX. Which is something he's, uh, always avoided.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Because if the jury slaps him with a big judgment, he might actually have to sell off parts of Tesla or SpaceX. Which is something he's, uh, always avoided.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the jury levels a large judgment against Musk, he may have to sell part of his stake in Tesla or SpaceX, a move he has historically avoided.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Or, like, borrow even more money against those shares, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, like, borrow even more money against those shares, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: (Another possibility: He could borrow more money, using his shares as collateral.)

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And speaking of borrowing, he’s already got quite a bit of debt himself. Over $500 million, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And speaking of borrowing, he's already got quite a bit of debt himself. Over five hundred million dollars, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More important, Musk, 48, owes more than $500 million in debts, according to financial documents published earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Half a billion? Wow. I mean, you think of his early successes like Zip2 and PayPal… he made a ton of money there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Half a billion? Wow. I mean, you think of his early successes like Zip2 and PayPal... he made a ton of money there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He made his first fortune after selling Zip2, a software firm, to Compaq in 1999 for a reported price of more than $300 million. Three years later Paypal, which he also cofounded, was acquired by eBay for $1.4 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: He did! But, um, according to his biography, most of those early PayPal earnings, they got poured straight into founding SpaceX and joining Tesla.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did! But, um, according to his biography, most of those early PayPal earnings, they got poured straight into founding SpaceX and joining Tesla.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The South Africa native founded SpaceX in 2002 and joined Tesla in 2004; the firms quickly exhausted most of his PayPal earnings, according to a 2015 Musk biography.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: And he always says it's not about maximizing riches, but, like, affecting the future of humanity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he always says it's not about maximizing riches, but, like, affecting the future of humanity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is not the path to go to maximize riches, he told Forbes in 2012, referring to SpaceX. Its a terrible risk-adjusted return. Instead he founded the space exploration company, he said, because it was his way to most affect the future of humanity and civilization. He has made similar comments about his motivations at Tesla.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: He does. But, uh, you know, his recent behavior has really kinda distracted from that initial vision, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He does. But, uh, you know, his recent behavior has really kinda distracted from that initial vision, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musks recent behavior has distracted from that initial vision.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. The whole "taking Tesla private" tweet, the SEC fine, stepping down as chairman...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. The whole taking Tesla private tweet, the S E C fine, stepping down as chairman...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to the defamation suit, he stirred controversy in 2018 after tweeting that he was considering taking Tesla private, an announcement that caught investors by surprise. Following an SEC investigation, he paid a $20 million fine and stepped down as the carmakers chairman.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And don't forget the Cybertruck unveiling! That, um, whole window shattering incident?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And don't forget the Cybertruck unveiling! That, um, whole window shattering incident?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, during the introduction of Teslas new Cybertruck, he attempted to prove the durability of the trucks armor glass windows with a metal ball. Instead the window shattered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my goodness, yes! "Oh my f***ing God," he said! Like, so embarrassing in the moment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my goodness, yes! Oh my f*ing God, he said! Like, so embarrassing in the moment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead the window shattered. Oh my fing God, said a surprised Musk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host B
dialogue_turns.text: But, you know, still, he's got over 250,000 preorders for the thing. So, uh, somehow it still works for him.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, you know, still, he's got over two hundred fifty thousand preorders for the thing. So, uh, somehow it still works for him.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Still, Musk reports that more than 250,000 customers have preordered the vehicle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I guess he just keeps making headlines, one way or another.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I guess he just keeps making headlines, one way or another.
